definition: a learned person need not leave his home to know what's going on in the world (idiom)
pinyin: xiu4 cai5 bu4 chu1 men2 , quan2 zhi1 tian1 xia4 shi4
traditional: 秀才不出門，全知天下事
word: 秀才不出门，全知天下事

definition: lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
To learn without thinking is confusing, to think without learning is dangerous (Confucius)
pinyin: xue2 er2 bu4 si1 ze2 wang3 , si1 er2 bu4 xue2 ze2 dai4
related.word: 学而不思则罔，思而不学则殆

definition: the rich man cannot be benevolent (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
lit. to catch sparrows blindfolded (idiom)/fig. to act blindly
pinyin: bi4 se4 yan3 jing1 zhuo1 ma2 que4

definition: to alter a text indiscriminately (idiom)/to make irresponsible criticism
to respect Gods and demons from a distance (idiom); to remain at a respectful distance
pinyin: jing4 gui3 shen2 er2 yuan3 zhi1

definition: If one is industrious, one will not be in want. (idiom)
lit. to hear one and know ten (idiom); fig. explain one thing and (he) understands everything/a word to the wise
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
to dig into piles of outdated writings (idiom); to study old books and papers

lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"
